证据片段: Comparing the billet beta quenching with the bar quenching (Process A), the nucleation rate of the intermetallic particles is expected to be higher in the former due to its higher cooling rate.

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_031_chunk5
证据片段: With the exception of the final recrystallization annealing of the samples subjected to the bar quenching, both the billet and bar quenched samples were exposed to the same thermal processing subsequent to the quench.

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_031_chunk5
证据片段: The hollow quenched sample is expected to have the highest nucleation rate for the intermetallic particles among the three samples examined.

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_031_chunk5
证据片段: For the Process A Zircaloy-2 samples, the ternary particles were based on either Zr2Ni or ZrCr2, both of which are the equilibrium particles expected in the Zr-Ni and Zr-Cr systems, respectively.

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_031_chunk6

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_031_chunk6
证据片段: In Zircaloy-2 the reduction in corrosion rate was more dramatic than the reduction in intermetallic particle sizes induced by aggressive beta-quenching treatments

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_031_chunk7
